Module wgu.inventoryfxmlapp
Package controller

Class AddPartFormController

java.lang.Object
controller.MainFormController
controller.AddPartFormController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class AddPartFormController extends MainFormController implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Controller for the Add Part Form UI.

This class handles the user interactions with the Add Part Form, allowing users to input data for new parts, either InHouse or OutSourced, and adding them to the inventory.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initializes the controller class.

      This method is automatically called after the FXML file has been loaded. It can be used to perform initializations such as setting event handlers or configuring UI controls.

      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Overrides:
      initialize in class MainFormController
      Parameters:
      url - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if unknown.
      resourceBundle - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if not localized.

    • onInHouse

      public void onInHouse(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Handles the action event when the InHouse radio button is selected.

      Changes the label to "Machine ID" to indicate the expected input for InHouse parts.

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event triggered when the InHouse radio button is selected.

    • onOutSourced

      public void onOutSourced(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Handles the action event when the OutSourced radio button is selected.

      Changes the label to "Company Name" to indicate the expected input for OutSourced parts.

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event triggered when the OutSourced radio button is selected.

    • onCancel

      public void onCancel(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Handles the cancel action.

      When the cancel button is pressed, the UI transitions back to the Main Form without adding a new part.

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event triggered when the cancel button is pressed.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the Main Form FXML file cannot be loaded.

    • onSaveAddPart

      public void onSaveAddPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Handles saving a new part to the inventory.

      Validates user input and adds a new InHouse or OutSourced part to the inventory based on the provided information. Displays confirmation or error messages as appropriate.

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event triggered when the save button is pressed.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an issue saving the part.
